noun.description: An agency or means of doing something.
examples: using the latest technology as a medium for job creation
their primitive valuables acted as a medium of exchange

noun.description: The intervening substance through which impressions are conveyed to the senses or a force acts on objects at a distance.
examples: radio communication needs no physical medium between the two stations
the medium between the cylinders is a vacuum

noun.description: A particular form of storage for digitized information, such as magnetic tape or discs.
examples: moving or copying backed-up data through a hierarchy of different mediums

noun.description: The material or form used by an artist, composer, or writer.
examples: oil paint is the most popular medium for glazing

noun.description: A person claiming to be in contact with the spirits of the dead and to communicate between the dead and the living.
The middle quality or state between two extremes; a reasonable balance.
examples: there is a medium between being modest and boastful

adjective.description: About halfway between two extremes of size or another quality; average.
examples: John is six feet tall, of medium build

origin: Late 16th century (originally denoting something intermediate in nature or degree): from Latin, literally middle, neuter of medius.
